titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale School of Drama Audio-Visual Recordings
Yale School of Drama Audio-Visual Recordings
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:41

did.unittitle: Yale School of Drama audio-visual recordings

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of audiovisual recordings documenting productions, marketing, presentations, symposia, and events of the Yale School of Drama and the Yale Repertory Theatre.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 22-H (YRG 22-H), Photographs, audiovisual materials, and memorabilia documenting the Yale School of Drama.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were transferred from the Drama Library, 2006-2008; School of Drama, 2009-2010 and 2013.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Duplication of media is prohibited to all non-authorized requestors.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale School of Drama Audio-Visual Recordings (RU 1024). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession, thereunder by production name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of audiovisual recordings documenting productions, marketing, presentations, symposia, and events of the Yale School of Drama and the Yale Repertory Theatre.

did.unittitle: Audiovisual recordings of productions, presentations, and events

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

unittitle.title: In Good King Charles' Golden Days

odd.head: General
odd.p: Performance ran from December 29-January 13, 1979, University Theatre. Directed by Steve Lawson; Music Direction and Arrangements – Rusty Magee; Choreography – Wesley Fata; Sets – Randy Drake; Costumes – Rita Ryack; Lighting – William M. Armstrong. Cast: Caris Corfman, Warren Manzi, Nancy Mayans, Dave K. Miller, H.S. Murphy, Elizabeth Norment, David Prittie.
